questions.question_text: After a notable event has been closed, how long will the meta data for that event remain in the KV Store by default?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Retention policy (time to hold notable info in KV store after episode is 
closed) is set in:
• etc/apps/SA-ITOA/local/itsi_notable_event_retention.conf
• Default 6 months

Selected Answer: A
p380 of slides

Retention and Notable Indexes
• Retention policy (time to hold notable info in KV store after episode is closed) is set in:
• etc/apps/SA-ITOA/local/itsi_notable_event_retention.conf • Default 6 months
What is the name of the slides?

Selected Answer: A
Stores episode tags that have been moved from the KV store after a default 6 month retention period

choices.D: Adding KPI metric lanes to glass tables.

questions.question_text: What are valid ITSI Glass Table editor capabilities? (Choose all that apply.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A and C are correct, lanes are used in Deep Dives.
A + C. Think D is just for Deep Dives.

choices.A: Comparing content between two notable events.
choices.B: Using machine learning to evaluate when data falls outside of an expected pattern.
choices.C: Comparing anomaly detection between two KPIs.
choices.D: Raising an alert when one or more KPIs indicate an outage is occurring.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the best use case for configuring a Multi-KPI Alert?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct.
D. Raising an alert when one or more KPIs indicate an outage is occurring - slide 391.

questions.question_text: In distributed search, which components need to be installed on instances other than the search head?

choices.C: SA-IndexCreation on idexers; SA-ITSI-Licensechecker and SA-UserAccess on the license master.
choices.B: SA-IndexCreation and SA-ITOA on indexers; SA-ITSI-Licensechecker and SA-UserAccess on the license master.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct.
C should be good answer for a clustered environment. Clustered environment is by default distributed environment, not vice versa.

questions.question_text: When deploying ITSI on a distributed Splunk installation, which component must be installed on the search head(s)?

discussion.content:
Slight conflict between B and C:
1: slide 427 says:
ITSI Component Locations
• Search heads: all ITSI 

• Indexers: SA-IndexCreation
• ITSI indexes
• License Master: SA-ITSI-Licensechecker and SA-UserAccess

per slide 429
Scenario: Distributed Search
• Extract ITSI app package in etc/apps
• Copy SA-IndexCreation to the indexers
• Copy SA-ITSI-Licensechecker
and SA-UserAccess to the license master
• Restart Splunk on all servers

B - as per slide 429
 Scenario: Distributed Search
• Extract ITSI app package in etc/apps
• Copy SA-IndexCreation to the indexers
• Copy SA-ITSI-Licensechecker
and SA-UserAccess to the license master
• Restart Splunk on all servers

Selected Answer: C
c is correct
C should be right, since in a distributed or on one-server installation everything should go to the Search Head. In a distributed environment set indexAndForward = false.
